intro: Dovyalis acuminata, commonly known as the sour plum or Natal plum, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, sour-tasting berries that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant has simple, alternate leaves and produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that turns from green to yellow or red when ripe. Dovyalis acuminata is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in regions with limited water availability.
